meanings.sent1: The small plant was transplantable to a bigger pot.
meanings.sent2: The surgeon carefully selected the transplantable organ for the patient.
meanings.sent3: The transplantable flower decided it was time for a change of scenery.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas were so transplantable that they flourished in any environment.
meanings.sent5: The concept of kindness is as transplantable as a seed, spreading wherever it lands.

meanings.definition: Capable of being moved from one place to another for transplantation.
meanings.sent1: The delicate tissue was transplantable to the new location.
meanings.sent2: The team ensured the transplantable heart was transported safely.
meanings.sent3: The transplantable tree waved goodbye to its old home as it was uprooted.
meanings.sent4: His infectious laughter was as transplantable as a joyful tune.
meanings.sent5: The spirit of hope is as transplantable as a ray of sunlight, bringing warmth wherever it goes.
